result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Roy Koeppen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs shall be paid from cash bond on file with any balance being returned to the poster.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

charges.descr: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Roy Koeppen

defendant.name: Koeppen, Jonathan Roy

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Defendant Jonathan Roy Koeppen in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Jonathan Roy Koeppen.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached.  State moves to amend charge to Misd Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1); Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to amended charge; Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
$500 cash bond amended to $1000 cash bond; Maintain absolute sobriety

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Jonathan Roy Koeppen appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant missed court as was dealing with some personal issues.  State requests $1,500.00 cash bond.  Defendant makes statements and states doesn't matter how high put the bond as cannot post the bond and continually speaks.  Defendant states cannot post any additional bond.  Court amends bond to $1,000.00 cash bond and cancels bail forfeiture.  Defendant states the injunction was dismissed. Court notes 22CV409 was dismissed.  Defendant continually makes statements.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Jonathan Roy Koeppen.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant and Bail Forfeiture ordered.

Hearing on September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Notice generated in error - DA & Atty. Beltran advised (defendant's copy NOT mailed)
22R 015722 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #15972 on 8-10-22
Absolute sobriety. Comply with all orders in 22CV409.

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan Roy Koeppen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran appeared by video for Jonathan Roy Koeppen. Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. SPD to appoint.  Court sets $500 cash bond.  Court enters NG plea on behalf of def.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
